tit.cmt: school で統一しています。

sen.j: 大倉流（おおくら-りゅう）は能楽囃子方の一流儀。
sen.e: Okura-ryu school is one of schools of Nohgaku hayasikata (people who play hayashi, or the musicl accompaniment).
The Okura school is one of the schools of hayashi-kata (people who play hayashi, or the musical accompaniment) in Nohgaku (the art of Noh).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The Okura school is one of the schools of hayashi-kata (people who play hayashi, or the musical accompaniment) in Nohgaku (the art of Noh).

sen.j: 大鼓方と小鼓方がある。
sen.e: There are Otsuzumikata (large hand drum player) and Kotsuzumikata (small hand drum player).
There are otsuzumi-kata (large hand drum players) and kotsuzumi-kata (small hand drum players).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: There are otsuzumi-kata (large hand drum players) and kotsuzumi-kata (small hand drum players).

tit.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 小鼓方大倉流は金春流座付きとして活躍した小鼓方の流儀。
sen.e: Okuraryu Kotsuzumikata is a school of Kotsuzumikata which performed as the accompanist of Konparu-ryu Noh play school.
Kotsuzumi-kata of Okura school is a school of kotsuzumi-kata which performed exclusively as the accompanist of Konparu school.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Kotsuzumi-kata of Okura school is a school of kotsuzumi-kata which performed exclusively as the accompanist of Konparu school.

sen.j: 大蔵権右衛門道意が家祖とされるが、実質的に流儀の基礎を築いたのは大鼓方三世二助虎家（道知）の養子となった二世長右衛門宣安と思われる。
sen.e: Its founder is believed to be Okura Gonuemon Michioki, but it is thought that a person who actually established the basis of school was the 2nd Choemon Nobuyasu, the adopted son of the 3rd Toraie (Michitomo) NISUKE of Otsuzumikata.

Its founder is believed to be Gonuemon Michioki (権右衛門道意) OKURA, but it is thought that a person who actually established the basis of school was the second head, Choemon Nobuyasu, the adopted son of the third head of otsuzumi-kata, Toraie (Michitomo) NISUKE (二助虎家 [道知]).
sen.cmt: 読み方が不明の人名に漢字を追記しました。名字を大文字で表現しました。
sen.e: Its founder is believed to be Gonuemon Michioki (権右衛門道意) OKURA, but it is thought that a person who actually established the basis of school was the second head, Choemon Nobuyasu, the adopted son of the third head of otsuzumi-kata, Toraie (Michitomo) NISUKE (二助虎家 [道知]).

sen.j: 宣安は大鼓方から出て、一流を築き、当時の立会能で活躍した名人であった。
sen.e: Nobuyasu, who turned from Otsuzumikata and established his own school, was a master who actively performed in taciai-Noh.
Nobuyasu, who turned from otsuzumi-kata and established his own school, was a master who actively performed in the Noh competitions called Tachiai Noh of the time.
sen.cmt: 立会能 補足を追加しました。
sen.e: Nobuyasu, who turned from otsuzumi-kata and established his own school, was a master who actively performed in the Noh competitions called Tachiai Noh of the time.

sen.j: 江戸時代には金春流の座付きとして活躍し、大鼓方大倉流をアシライ鼓とした。
sen.e: The school actively performed as the accompanist of Konparu-ryu Noh play school in the Edo period, and it used Okuraryu Otsuzumikata as ashirai-tsuzumi (accompanying hand drum).
The school actively performed as the accompanist of Konparu school in the Edo period, and it used otsuzumi-kata of Okura school as ashirai tsuzumi (accompanying hand drum).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The school actively performed as the accompanist of Konparu school in the Edo period, and it used otsuzumi-kata of Okura school as ashirai tsuzumi (accompanying hand drum).

sen.j: 東京、大阪などが主要な地盤で、能楽協会に登録された役者は20名余。
sen.e: Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Osaka etc., and some twenty players are being registered at The Nohgaku Performers' Association.
Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Osaka etc., and over 20 players are registered with the Nohgaku Performers' Association.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Osaka etc., and over 20 players are registered with the Nohgaku Performers' Association.

sen.j: 調緒のかけかたがゆるく、やわらかい音を特色とするため、ポ・プの音は聞きわけにくい。
sen.e: As it uses loose shirabeo and its tone quality is soft, it is difficult to distinguish the tone of "po" from the tone of "pu".

As it uses loose shirabeo (a set of ropes used for Kotsuzumi [a small hand drum], Otsuzumi [a large hand drum] and Shime-daiko [a rope-tuned drum]) and its tone quality is soft, it is difficult to distinguish the tone of "po" from the tone of "pu."
sen.cmt: 調緒 補足を追加しました。
sen.e: As it uses loose shirabeo (a set of ropes used for Kotsuzumi [a small hand drum], Otsuzumi [a large hand drum] and Shime-daiko [a rope-tuned drum]) and its tone quality is soft, it is difficult to distinguish the tone of "po" from the tone of "pu."

sen.j: また打つ指を変えて音色に変化を持たせるのも特色の一つ。
sen.e: Its another characteristic is a technique to diversify the tone quality by changing fingers for beating a drum.
Its another characteristic is a technique to diversify the tone quality by changing fingers for beating a drum.
Its another characteristic is a technique to diversify the tone quality by changing fingers for beating a drum.

sen.j: 近代の名人に北村一郎、鵜沢寿、北村治など。
sen.e: Ichiro KITAMURA, Hisashi Uzawa and Osamu KITAMURA are among masters in the early modern times.
Ichiro KITAMURA, Hisashi UZAWA and Osamu KITAMURA are among masters in the early modern times.
sen.cmt: 名字を大文字で表記しました。
sen.e: Ichiro KITAMURA, Hisashi UZAWA and Osamu KITAMURA are among masters in the early modern times.

sen.j: 現宗家は十六世大倉源次郎。
sen.e: Current soke (head of school) is the 16th Genjiro OKURA.
Current head of school is the 16th, Genjiro OKURA.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Current head of school is the 16th, Genjiro OKURA.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 大鼓方大倉流は金春流座付きとして活躍した大鼓方の流儀。
sen.e: Okuraryu Otsuzumikata is a school of Otsuzumikata which performed as the accompanist of Konparu-ryu Noh play school.
Otsuzumi-kata of Okura school is a school of otsuzumi-kata which performed as the accompanist of Konparu school.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Otsuzumi-kata of Okura school is a school of otsuzumi-kata which performed as the accompanist of Konparu school.

sen.j: 金春禅竹の三男大蔵道加が分家し、子の二世九郎能氏が観世信光に師事して一流を興した。
sen.e: After Doka OKURA, the third son of Zenchiku Konparu, established a branch family, his son the second Kuro Yoshiuji established the school under the guidance of Nobumitsu KANZE.
After Doka (道加) OKURA, the third son of Zenchiku KONPARU, established a branch family, his son, the second generation head Kuro Yoshiuji established the school under the guidance of Nobumitsu KANZE.
sen.cmt: 読み不明の人名に漢字を追記しました。
sen.e: After Doka (道加) OKURA, the third son of Zenchiku KONPARU, established a branch family, his son, the second generation head Kuro Yoshiuji established the school under the guidance of Nobumitsu KANZE.

sen.j: 三世二助虎家（道知）は織田信長の贔屓を受け、四世平蔵正氏、五世源右衛門正幸は紫の調緒を許された。
sen.e: The second Toraie (Michitomo) NISUKE enjoyed Nobunaga ODA's favor, and the fourth Heizo Masauji and the fifth Genuemon Nasayuki were successively allowed to use purple shirabeo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The third head, Toraie (Michitomo) NISUKE enjoyed Nobunaga ODA's favor, and the fourth head, Heizo Masauji and the fifth head, Genuemon Masayuki were successively allowed to use purple shirabeo.
sen.cmt: second→ third に修正しました。一部翻訳を補足しました。
sen.e: The third head, Toraie (Michitomo) NISUKE enjoyed Nobunaga ODA's favor, and the fourth head, Heizo Masauji and the fifth head, Genuemon Masayuki were successively allowed to use purple shirabeo.

sen.j: しかし、正幸に後嗣がなかったために、小鼓方二世大倉宣安の孫仁右衛門宣充が六世を相続した。
sen.e: However, as Masayuki had no children, Niemon Nobumitsu, a grandson of the second Nobuyasu OKURA of Kotsuzumikata, inherited the position of the sixth head of school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, as Masayuki had no children, Niemon Nobumitsu, who was a grandson of the second head of kotsuzumi-kata Nobuyasu OKURA, inherited the position of the sixth head of school.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を補足しました。
sen.e: However, as Masayuki had no children, Niemon Nobumitsu, who was a grandson of the second head of kotsuzumi-kata Nobuyasu OKURA, inherited the position of the sixth head of school.

sen.j: 以後は小鼓方のアシライ鼓として終始し、江戸時代中期以降は奈良に在住して尾張藩の扶持を受けた。
sen.e: The school constantly performed ashirai-tsuzumi for Kotsuzumikata since then, and from the middle of Edo period, it received salary from the Owari domain while residing in Nara.
The school constantly performed ashirai tsuzumi for kotsuzumi-kata since then, and from the middle of Edo period, it received salary from the Owari Domain while residing in Nara.
sen.cmt: Domain を大文字にしました。
sen.e: The school constantly performed ashirai tsuzumi for kotsuzumi-kata since then, and from the middle of Edo period, it received salary from the Owari Domain while residing in Nara.

sen.j: 維新後、十五世七左衛門が囃子方の申合せを破って梅若流に参加したため、家元の座を追われた。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the 15th Shichizaemon joined in Umewak-ryu school by breaking the agreement of hayashikata and was deprived of the position of iemoto (the head of school).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the 15th head Shichizaemon joined Umewaka school by breaking the agreement of hayashi-kata and was deprived of the position of iemoto (the head of school).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the 15th head Shichizaemon joined Umewaka school by breaking the agreement of hayashi-kata and was deprived of the position of iemoto (the head of school).

sen.j: 以降小鼓方の家元が大鼓方を預っている。
sen.e: Since then, the iemoto of Kotsuzumikata has served as the iemoto of Otzuzumikata concurrently.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since then, the iemoto of kotsuzumi-kata has served as the iemoto of otsuzumi-kata concurrently.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Since then, the iemoto of kotsuzumi-kata has served as the iemoto of otsuzumi-kata concurrently.

sen.j: 東京、大阪などが主要な地盤で、能楽協会に登録された役者は10名余。
sen.e: Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Osaka etc., and some ten players are being rgistered at The Noh Players's Association.
Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Osaka etc., and some ten players are registered with the Nohgaku Performers' Association.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Osaka etc., and some ten players are registered with the Nohgaku Performers' Association.

sen.j: 手組みの数そのものが少なく、掛け声などにも古風を残す。
sen.e: Its number of tegumi (a rhythm pattern) is small and an ancient style remains in kakegoe (a call).
Its number of tegumi (a rhythm pattern) is small and an ancient style remains in kakegoe (a call).
Its number of tegumi (a rhythm pattern) is small and an ancient style remains in kakegoe (a call).

sen.j: 長らく小鼓方大倉流のアシライ鼓であったため、手組みはもっとも同流に適する。
sen.e: As it had long been the ashirai-tsuzumi of Okura-ryu Kotsuzumikata, its tegumi is the most suitable one for Okura-ryu Kotsuzumikata.
As it had long been the ashirai tsuzumi of kotsuzumi-kata of Okura school, its tegumi is the most suitable one for the said school.
As it had long been the ashirai tsuzumi of kotsuzumi-kata of Okura school, its tegumi is the most suitable one for the said school.
